p: The signal at 98.96 ppm was assigned to C1 of 1,3-β-Gal p (residue D) [ 27]. The cross peak (4.96/98.96 ppm) in HSQC showed that the anomeric proton signal of residue D was assigned at 4.96 ppm. According to 1H- 1H COSY and HSQC, the signals at δ 75.88, 78.51, 73,55, 68.64 and 60.61 ppm were assigned to C2-C6 of residue D, and the corresponding signals at δ 3.76, 3.59, 3.82, 3.93 and 3.65 ppm were assigned to H2-H6 of residue D.
